website_summaries.verdict: Cuisinart chef's convection oven boasts 15 cooking functions and offers special settings for speed convection, sandwiches, and bagels.
pros: Heating power of 1800 watts gives fast heat-up, precise temperature, and perfect results every time
Updated control panel with internal light
Includes two wire racks, broiler pan, and pizza stone
Preheats quickly and oven maintains temp as set
cons: Button labels could rub off over time and/or extended use
Pizza setting takes time to heat up
Door does close tightly but exterior gets hot

customer_reviews.title: Button Labels Rub Off
customer_reviews.text: This oven does a good job with toasting. It's so-so at broiling. Have not used it for baking. I down rated it because shortly after using it all the button labels began to rub off. Now I can't read them at all. Called customer service and agent said she never heard of this problem before and the only option was to have the unit replaced, However, I had to pay shipping. "We don't pay for shipping at all." is the exact quote. It's not worth my trouble; the new unit will likely do the same thing. Time for my trusty Dymo labeler. Nice woman, but poor policy.
customer_reviews.author: Blackhorse

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: My advice to any potential purchasers: Do Not Buy Under Any Circumstances. The oven door does not close completely. The build quality is extremely poor. On first use, the oven kept heating and heating - never reaching the required temperature. The unit and cord became extremely hot and blew out the fuses in the apartment. The cord and wall plug were extremely hot - and I narrowly missed a fire/disaster. I'm returning the product to Amazon for a refund. Please note the dangerous consequences of that ill fitting door that other reviewers have mentioned. (There's no option other than to put one star here for a review, of course)
customer_reviews.author: jr

customer_reviews.title: Great Oven!
customer_reviews.text: I use this everyday and the only things I can say negatively about it are that I wish the door closed tightly and the exterior does get hot. After reading the other reviews, I did put tape on each button to make sure the ink did not fade away. After using this oven for several months, I can say that I'm not seeing any issues at all. In convection mode or in regular baking mode it heats up quickly and bakes, broils, or toasts efficiently and accurately and its just a joy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Aerie

customer_reviews.title: Warning - Do not purchase - electrical hazard
customer_reviews.text: Side and front are insulated, but rear is not (unlike other options) and will reach very high temperatures. Melted the plastic plug. No mention in manual. We longer use this and cuisinart did not offer adequate support - we can ship it back at our expense for their review and see if it warrants repair. Very disappointed, as other cuisinart products are top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Electrical cord
customer_reviews.text: I love this toaster oven but after 6 months we've discovered the electrical cord is too lightweight for such a powerful little oven. The plug and about 6 inches of the cord is heating up not just warm but hot to the touch. Outlets were checked and not the problem. I'm hoping a heavier electrical cord can be installed.
customer_reviews.author: Rei Hamlet

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS P.O.C.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this POC (piece of crap), because it got good reviews, even outside of amazon. It lasted a month and then one day the digital reading shot out an error code (ERL). Apparently it’s very typical for this oven to do this because the contacts get fried and then the oven doesn’t work anymore. I mean, are you kidding CUISINART?! Charging $200 for an oven that works for a month?!! I’m super aggravated, because I can’t even get a live person on the phone to try to get this situation figured out. I guess it’s a loss for me, I’ll never buy another cuisinart product again.
customer_reviews.author: GKDK

customer_reviews.title: Design Features
customer_reviews.text: So after three months of using this oven on average of four days a week al am very pleased with is design and function. Yea the door has a slight gap when closed but no big deal - Preheats fast. The illuminated controls are easy to use and the internal light is a blessing. Read where the black ink my wear off on some of the buttons so before using it I added a layer of clear nail polish sealer over the buttons - cannot even see it and buttons look just fine. The 30 second add time button gets a lot of use. Upper surface gets hot - most ovens do this - so place accordingly. Great unit.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: You wont regret it
customer_reviews.text: This is the best purchase I have made for my kitchen to date. No more toaster that has one function and takes up space. I have made chicken, desserts, and regular toast/bagels with ease. When you first purchase and are setting up I strongly recommend running it for an hour in convection mode outside of your house (I placed mine on the pavement), as well as an hour regular mode, at a high temp. This will burn off whatever residue from manufacturing is in the unit and will erradicate the initial strong electrical burning smell.
customer_reviews.author: KidVictorious

customer_reviews.title: Worked a years
customer_reviews.text: Moved to new home so replaced my worn looking but working great Breville with this one. Worked great in beginning so bought one for each of my daughters. Mine still works for toast but fan stopped working a year ago and now it just started running again but won’t stop. I plug it in to toast and unplug when finished. I’m looking for a replacement. Might go back to breville. Note: I was happy with it when it worked- pizza, cake, potatoes everything.
customer_reviews.author: bogiesmom

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: Once we got the unit the box was damaged, looks like its been dropped half a dozen times. Opened the box to find multiple dents, the unit still started, warmed up to 350 or so, then DIED. less Then 10 Mins of use. DONT EVEN THINK of putting anything on top of the unit while its turned on, the top gets hot enough to melt plastic spoons. never seen a toaster oven top get this hot at 350. The trays that come with this unit warp Extremely Bad once the temp starting going up.
customer_reviews.author: keke zundy

customer_reviews.title: LCD Backlight Stays On Even When Not in Use.
customer_reviews.text: After about six months of use, the blue LCD backlight stays on all the time, even when the toaster oven is not in use. This is annoying, but what makes it worse, is that Cuisinart customer support says the the LCD backlight is supposed to stay on all the time, which is obviously a lie. When it was new the LCD backlight automatically shuts off when not in use. It's a shame that Cuisinart customer support would use a lie to fend off customer complains.
customer_reviews.author: C. Meng

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but they missed the details
customer_reviews.text: The oven is quiet and has lots of different cooking modes which all seem to work pretty well. I didn't like the results I got with the pizza mode so I'll stick with good old fashioned bake from now on. My biggest complaint is that the labels started coming off the buttons within the first month of owning it and the control knob is loose and wobbly. They were so close to making a really good product but they dropped the ball at the 5 yard line.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Sticka

customer_reviews.title: Dial malfunctions
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t know how to use it at first but by time I figured out the dial misfunctions it was too late to return it. When you move the dial it skips over things like into a different setting you didn’t want or a different temperature. Really frustrating. The actual heating is good but because you spend so much time frustrated on the dial I am giving this a 1 star. If the company would like to fix it or send me another functioning one I will revise my review.
customer_reviews.author: Melly

customer_reviews.title: Works good and I do like the easy setup menu
customer_reviews.text: Works good and I do like the easy setup menu. However not all stainless steel, mostly aluminium and labels on the control buttons are already fading out. Looks like they just painted on and not laser edging.
customer_reviews.author: William Tran

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster oven, rubbish labels on controls
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toaster oven as many reviews will tell you. But in just weeks, the label on the Start - Stop control button has mostly worn off. The same thing has happened to our Cuisinart electric kettle. This is a small detail, but it not only makes the predict look like drap, it eventually makes it hard to use. I gave Han many appliances that cost far less that never wore through the knob lab keys, Cuisinart needs to do a lot better here.
customer_reviews.author: B. Williston

customer_reviews.title: Selector Knob Faulty
customer_reviews.text: Bought one, selector knob malfunctioned with two months. Cuisinart replaced it promptly. Selector knob malfunctioned within two months. Many similar reviews. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Roderick C. Dennehy, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Very good with one minor, but annoying, problem
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toaster oven. It's spacious, but heats fairly quickly because of its high wattage. The convection fan is so quiet that I'm a little worried that it may be underpowered. But, as others have noted, the markings on the buttons wears off very quickly. So, I'm deducting a star.
customer_reviews.author: DCP123

customer_reviews.title: Extremely hot on the outside-beware
customer_reviews.text: This oven gets extremely hot on the outside. I mean so hot you could fry and egg on the top and sides of it. Cord gets super hot as well. This should not be like that! My husband scalded his arm on when he set is arm down not knowing it will still hot. He has a scar on his arm and I’m extremely disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst Customer Serivces, broke after 5 months of light use
customer_reviews.text: This unit never did make a slice of toast well, the unit has had very little use and after 5 months of use the display gives an error message (ErL), when I go thru to customer service on a Sunday was told they need to send a replacement, but not able to assist at time of my call as their computer was down. I have called numerous times, only to be place on hold in excess of 30 minutes each time. No response to my emails to customer services
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Hill

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: We love everything about this toaster oven. We bought it several months ago and have used it 2 or 3 times a day, every single day, and have never been disappointed with it's performance! In fact, we hardly ever use our big oven anymore. Truly one of the best investments we have ever made. It's easy to use and easy to clean, and the results ar always perfection. I noticed a lot of complaints about the paint peeling off the buttons, but that has not been an issue for us at all, and we use it a lot! I can't recommend it highly enough!
customer_reviews.author: M. Franz

customer_reviews.title: Great oven--much of my Pyrex bakeware fits!
customer_reviews.text: Received this week--like VERY much. In particular, I like that a lot of my Pyrex bakeware fits in the oven as well as the ability to use two racks. Cooked a casserole and a cherry crisp at the same time. Also like the timer feature--added two minutes of broiling to the cherry crisp and the topping was beautifully browned. Also glad for 3 year warranty. Wasn't sure I would like the way it looked but it is beautiful. Controls were easy to learn.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Geisman

customer_reviews.title: I may never turn on my big oven again
customer_reviews.text: I'm a single woman, and at first when I got this toaster oven, I thought "well this thing is too big, I'll probably try to sell it to one of neighbors." But I decided to try it out that night just for kicks--and I've used it every night for dinner since. This oven does it ALL, and does it well. The pizza stone is awesome, the broiler is amazing. It heats up in a flash, and cools off quickly too. I have no problems with mine feeling "too hot" on the outside--and I've used it at 450 degrees to make pizza. Terrific product
customer_reviews.author: TXSapphire

customer_reviews.title: The dial sucks
customer_reviews.text: The dial doesn’t work right. If your turn it and expect the numbers to go down they jump up and down there is no rhyme or reason to it. The timer starts from when the oven reaches temp which differs from other toaster ovens so be prepared to change all your cooking times.
customer_reviews.author: Eli G

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: First. Coated control buttons with clear finger nail polish. Second. Copied "Quick Start Guide". Copied "Getting to know your Control Panel". Cut both to 5 1/2" x 8 1/2". Had them laminated back-to-back. Use most every day.
customer_reviews.author: TikTokTru

customer_reviews.title: Not a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: After about 6 months of using this oven the fuse started to overheat. Called the warranty they were no help told me the replacement was being sent. After a follow up call they told me it was never even processed. A headache. Need to fix my wall and cuisinart is not getting back to me!
customer_reviews.author: Hamlet Chraghchian

customer_reviews.title: Gives Breville a run for their money. I got ...
customer_reviews.text: Gives Breville a run for their money. I got this on sale, so it was almost half the price of Breville’s equivalent model and has triple the warranty length. Only one odd thing since I’ve been using it- one of the clips that’s holds the bottom front burner element has turned a darker color than the other clips on the elements. Not sure it matters since it could just be wear and tear related, but will keep an eye on it and update the review if anything happens.
customer_reviews.author: Brian T

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great.
customer_reviews.text: I got this one because it was rated as one of the two best ones of its category by Wirecutter. Although it’s a good size, as it fits a 12” pizza (the stone that comes with it is 13”), the height isn’t good enough for the horizontal area it has. Unless you’re baking cookies , you can’t basically use more than one rack. That’s a huge flaw. Also, the heat isn’t even. The front right corner always gets burned before the rest is baked, which isn’t a huge problem when you’re roasting veggies but a huge problem when you’re baking a cake or bread. Other than those flaws, it looks good and it’s easy to operate and clean.
customer_reviews.author: M. Souza

customer_reviews.title: Returning to amazon.com
customer_reviews.text: Returning to amazon.com. Defective, stays in preheat mode when following instructions for fresh pizza so it never goes into timer mode when cooking fresh pizza. Faint dull clicking type noise in convection mode, doesn’t make the noise on speed convection. Back gets a lot hotter than the top, the manual states: "A fire may occur if the oven is covered or touching flammable materials such as curtains, draperies, walls and the like when in operation. Do not store any items on top of the appliance when in operation. Do not operate under wall cabinets". All the counters in my kitchen have wall cabinets above them. IMO this is a poorly designed product that also has quality control issues.
customer_reviews.author: flylow

customer_reviews.title: Still getting used to it.
customer_reviews.text: The Cuisinart TOB-260N1 is probably too fancy for me. I had an older model that I absolutely loved so I bought this one with great anticipation. However, using it is much more complicated so I don’t use it as regularly as the old one. Now, that being said, I am 70 years old and if anyone ever tells you that 70 is the new 60, punch him in the nose! Still, I’m hoping that when I have it a few more months, I’ll be more comfortable with it.
customer_reviews.author: lily

customer_reviews.title: Great Oven, Hit or Miss Quality Sucks
customer_reviews.text: After my 4th return, I finally got one that was right. The oven is awesome but the quality control is lacking. It does not feel like a premium appliance, especially when you consider it's a $200 toaster oven. Seals have been bad (watch heat escape), power supply surging to keep light on while heating, and then I got a returned one with crusty food on it.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Dude Abiding

customer_reviews.title: Roto dial broken < 18 months
customer_reviews.text: The rotary dial, which controls functions and temperature, broke in less than two years. Instead of one click up/down changing the function or adjusting the temperature +/- 25 degrees, every click is jittery and jumps all over the place so it's nearly impossible to set the temperature or choose which bake setting is desired. See video. Seems totally unacceptable for such an expensive appliance. Wouldn't expect that from a $30-50 toaster oven, never mind one that cost $200. Will not replace it with another Cuisinart product.
customer_reviews.author: Terris L S Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 weeks. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 3 weeks. The computer on the oven seems to be broken, showing an “ErL” error when trying to use it. It used to reset after unplugging it but it now displays this every time. So far customer service has been laughable. Will update the review if I ever receive a replacement but at this point that seems as likely as a room of monkeys with typewriters writing hamlet.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Owens

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely!!
customer_reviews.text: Just sorry I did not replace my OLD toaster with the TO260N1 sooner. The size is perfect in a very compact counter space. Great for cooking meal for two when "one" has a big appetite. There are so many options for baking, broiling, warming. I am still finding more ways to take advantage of this. I did opt to buy this over the air fryer. This oven fit in the same compact space of my older oven and can do more. The cost is well worth the asking. This is what a "toaster" oven should be able to do. Thank You Cusinart.
customer_reviews.author: mkdar

customer_reviews.title: Great oven
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY LIKE this toaster oven. Funny, I also like the ability to put my cold coffee cups or plates in and hit the warming button for 2 minutes. This is exactly what I needed. If yiu are concerned about the letters rubbing off, buy from Costco. Much better return policy. 3 month review: Still love this toaster oven. I recommend it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Gazoo

customer_reviews.title: VERY GOOD
customer_reviews.text: Love - Sturdy. Works well. Bigger than average toaster oven - only complaint - do not like knob control to select kind of cooking and the and temperature.
customer_reviews.author: If_This_Ain't_Love_How_Do_We_Get_Out?

customer_reviews.title: Toasts bread on both sides perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time finding out if this actually toasts bread, English muffins and bagels well. I can report it does an awesome job on all three! Both sides of toast are beautifully browned to what setting you wish (I prefer 4 myself for my thick cut french bread I have most days) and the bagel setting is great for bagels because they get toasty on the top (cut side) and stay a little chewier on the bottom. I tried bagels on the toast setting and I preferred them on the bagel setting.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Serves my purpose very well.
customer_reviews.text: Our Viking stove gave out and finding someone to fix it was near impossible. So we purchased this counter top oven and it has worked quite well. It's taken me a while to learn how to make decent pizza. I now put the pizza stone in second from bottom rack and turn on broil (500 degrees) and heat the stone for close to an hour. I then make the pizza a parchment paper, put it in oven on top of parchment paper and 5 minutes into cooking I remove the paper and cook another 10 minutes (15 all told). Comes out very tasty. Have made banana bread many times, Italian cheese cake, and hamburgers. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Brophy

customer_reviews.title: Not Insulated and Gets Dangerously Hot on the Exterior
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this toaster oven based on its great reviews. However, we returned it because: 1. It’s NOT insulated and the outside of the machine gets WAY too hot. It melted part of a matchbox car sitting on the counter next to it. 2. It’s massive size takes up too much room in our kitchen. It fills 3/4 plus of the counter depth and is much taller than our old one. I read the dimensions so this part not shocking. However, I’m visual so seeing it in person was different.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased Except for the Beeper
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am very happy with this oven. With respect to what it is supposed to do, I give it 5 stars. My only complaint is the beeper. I know I don't have the best hearing, but they could have put a little more volume into it. "0" of course is no sound. "1" is the default sound level and "2" is supposed to be loud. On "2" I can just hear it as long as I'm within 5 feet with no TV or music playing. If either of those are on, forget it. As such I have to use the timer on my phone to be safe. Wish it were as loud as my microwave. Otherwise a great oven.
customer_reviews.author: NorCalYachtie

customer_reviews.title: ease of use
customer_reviews.text: i dislike the control settings. very convoluted procedure to use. i have to get the manual out every time i use it. also the lettering on some button switch's has came off.
customer_reviews.author: larry

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin
customer_reviews.text: This oven is so much larger than the one it replaced. It’s really nice to be able to fit a full size baking pan or good sized roasting pan. The presets are “close enough” for most things, but they can easily be adjusted. As for the labels being worn off, I haven’t run into that yet, but I guess by that time I will have memorized them. It’s infrared convection like my old one, which is what I was looking for. All in all, very satisfied after throwing out the old one, an old black and decker that lived a good long life, which I hope this one lives.
customer_reviews.author: OccupyYourHeart

customer_reviews.title: Best 'Extra' Oven Ever
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure where these poor reviews are coming from. I have ordered this oven or bought it at BBB 3 times, they didn't break, my daughters loved them so I just gave them mine and got a new one. They feel the same way. This thing is a total workhorse at my house. Labels rubbing off the buttons, never has happened, uneven heating, never happened and this thing gets used every day. I did get the air fryer oven just because I have the counter space but returned it bc if I'm gonna eat fried food, which is rare, i don't wanna fake it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Whitley

customer_reviews.title: Rack sticks, scrapes finish off of inside of oven
customer_reviews.text: The main reason for the 2-star review is that the rack is scraping the finish off the back of the inside of the oven when we close the door. When I called support, I will have to pay for shipping a new unit, as well as for shipping the old one back. Over time I think this is going to ruin the inside of the oven. this only happens on the toaster rack level, which is the one we use everyday. They are willing to send me another rack, but that is not the problem....
customer_reviews.author: WendyF

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We'd been following all the hype re: air fryers and were considering one. We read the assessments that told us that these compact convection ovens would do all the same things and more. We're glad we listened. We're a retired family of two and haven't used our conventional oven since this one arrived. We've used it to bake, broil, toast a multitude of foods and couldn't be more pleased. Someone said, and I agree, that the alert signal (up to temp, timer, etc) could be louder. We actually keep a louder standalone time right by our oven. That's our only criticism. Get one - you'll be glad.
customer_reviews.author: Jim L.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Been using this toaster oven for many different things. My stove has an oven but I never felt like using it for fear of burning down the apt or something. My options for food opened up so much. Pizza, cake, baked potatoes, chicken, bread... It all comes out perfectly cooked. It also doesn't generate heat outside, but it does get very hot. The accessories that came with it are also great. Easy to clean up, except the pizza stone, and feel durable.
customer_reviews.author: Igniz

customer_reviews.title: I wish the look would be as great as how it works.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the various functions and use it a lot. A couple of things - annoying but not severe enough to go through the hassle of retuning the item when I received it. There was a small dent on the bottom front of the toaster oven and the coating of the the removable catch it all tray was spotty, the coating does not cover the whole tray. They (company building it) basically did a lousy job coating the tray. Since this would not impact function, I didn’t exchange. Anyway, I thought with the name brand there would be more emphasis on appearance.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie R.

customer_reviews.title: NICE!
customer_reviews.text: Good even heating. Nothing is "easy" to clean, but this is certainly no worse than any other oven. The dial takes a bit of getting used to (I tend to go past the setting I want) but works smoothly. The size is perfect and easily cooks things that I would normally use a full size oven for.
customer_reviews.author: TomCatRanch

customer_reviews.title: Broken in three months
customer_reviews.text: Ordered on March 30. Died on June 26. Used it as my oven, not daily, but sometimes multiple times a day.
customer_reviews.author: Mj Bute

customer_reviews.title: Replaced household oven
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this for a year now and are still loving it with no problems. (have not used convection feature) I just recommended it to a neighbor and noticed that the price has gone up $100. It’s still worth it! It has replaced our household oven except when you have big gatherings such as Thanksgiving; then you will use it along with your regular oven. It does cook faster than recommended cooking times; so be careful not to burn your food. Only complaint I have is that I haven’t been able to find anything to clean the glass door with and it’s looking pretty yucky.
customer_reviews.author: Coby's Corner

customer_reviews.title: Controls stopped working after 10 months
customer_reviews.text: Great size, interesting features, but the electronics stopped working after 10 months - the rotary dial to selected cooking type, temperature, etc stopped working. Cannot get through the 1-800 number for customer support and to send an email for support requires a serial number but the oven has no serial number on it (counterfeit?). Do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Dartos

customer_reviews.title: pizza stone doesn't fit
customer_reviews.text: the pizza stone is too big for the oven ! one of the reasons I bought the oven .
customer_reviews.author: Frank Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have for small amounts warmed up
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after using one at my daughter's. So easy and convenient to use. We love heating up a few rolls instead of using main oven. Toast comes out perfect. We haven't done anything with pizza yet. Does take up counter space, so something to consider when buying one where you intend on putting it. Still glad we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little oven
customer_reviews.text: Ok. Past reviews mentioned the print rubbing off the buttons, but I decided to purchase anyway. I'm so glad I did. Yes mine is losing the print already, but I love this little oven. We use it at least once a day. Very easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: AlaskanMom

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 1 month. "Erl" error code
customer_reviews.text: When it worked , it was great...large, versatile toaster oven. However after one month of normal household use, "Erl" code flashed and shuts off oven. After unplugging and letting oven cool, sometimes it worked again and sometimes Erl code of death flashes. Now Erl happens all the time, regardless of time/temp used or oven settings. Its clearly an electronic issue. Expected much better for the price and reputation of Cuisinart. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: H. Tseng

customer_reviews.title: Small Amount of Damage Inside the Box
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used this oven yet because it was delivered today, however it seems like many new products I buy these days have some amount of damage right out of the box. This oven is no exception. It’s not enough to face the hassle of returning such a large, heavy item, but there is a small ‘ding’ on the front panel. Seems like the Cuisinart inspection process should have caught this as there was nothing about the packing that should have caused it in shipment. I’m looking forward to trying this oven though, and will edit this review once I have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better Than The Breville Oven(s) We Gave Up On
customer_reviews.text: After 3 failed Breville ovens (Frequently shutting off in the middle of cooking with E05 error codes) this oven, so far, has just worked. Very happy with our decision to switch to this oven. With just 2 of us, we use it several times a week to cook dinner meals.
customer_reviews.author: Gary A

customer_reviews.title: GREAT OVEN
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice oven. The only thing I did was to place clear plastic tape over the buttons (as everyone was complaining about the printing wearing off). I hope this helps with life expectancy. The functions are really nice, and the heating elements are of the high intensity lamp type which warms up the oven really fast. If I had any negative comment on this product it's that the rotary encoder (function knob) feels "cheap", or "loose". I just hope that it lasts. Otherwise I'm very glad I purchased this oven when our old one died. Well worth the extra $'s. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Size difference
customer_reviews.text: Sent back immediately because the size was smaller than website stated. No way one could fit two 9 x 13 pans in this oven. I never tried the oven because it wasn't as large as I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Jensen

customer_reviews.title: This is a great countertop oven
customer_reviews.text: This is a great countertop oven. Easy to use and the super-convection cooks your food really fast. I have baked in it and like it better than my large oven. I bought this so I could use an oven and not heat my kitchen up in an Arizona summer. However, the oven does get extremely hot and does throw off heat. I read this in past reviews and keep it in my laundry room and shut the door while it's in use. Problem solved. The dials/settings are very intuitive and it's easy to change things mid-cycle if you want to. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Broiler pan problem
customer_reviews.text: Have only had the oven for one day and it did a great job on cooking pizza. However, the oven arrived with two identical broiler pans, both with venting holes in the bottom but not the drip pan advertised which makes it impossible to use either of the broiler pans. The oven has the good Cuisinart quality but I sure wish it had been properly packaged so I would have gotten the broiler pan and the drip pan as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Geraldine V.

customer_reviews.title: I love frozen pizzas
customer_reviews.text: I love frozen pizzas. I had a commercial Wisco pizza cooker for years that I made frozen bar type pizza in. I retired that unit after finding this. Wow what a difference. And it does all the other bachelor stuff like pot pies, etc so well! I have found that I go to this many more times than I fire up the big oven. Don't get me wrong, I do know how to cook, but this is so damn convenient... I've been using it for a few months now. Good stuff...and I rarely write any reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ERL Code in 7 months
customer_reviews.text: 7 months with limited use? Piece of junk! Thank god for tariffs!! Will not buy a Cuisinart product again. Can you tell I was hungry?
customer_reviews.author: Gina Graziano

customer_reviews.title: I cannot believe how much better I can roast veggies/potatoes compared to my old -oven!  warranty
customer_reviews.text: 100% read the reviews online for this oven, it is ***outstanding!*** I tend to "steak" my veggies by cutting them lengthwise, and I cook daily to have control over what I eat. This oven carmelized my sweet potatoes and eggplant with very little olive oil, roasting them perfectly. Perfectly! The first try! It has a pretty good capacity for larger items, but I am hooked on roasting veggies and broiling any meat items. LOVE it!! : ) : ) : ) Money very well spent! The picture is of the limited three year warranty given by Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Buys Online

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I love the new toaster oven. I purchased this toaster oven to replace my old Cuisinart toaster oven. The oven is large and spacious. I like the larger racks...it allows me to add more toast for my morning sessions. I was surprised at how easy it is to select toast/bagel/etc. and then select the color/temperature. Although, I haven't quite mastered the desired temperature/color of my toast I'm looking forward to mastering my settings. The toast oven is easy to clean and looks great in the kitchen. I'm happy with my purchase and look forward to clean all the feachers.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene M. Middendorf

customer_reviews.title: Excellent oven!!
customer_reviews.text: Best convection toaster out there, especially for the price. We've had one for about 9 months. My daughter loved it so much that when she moved in to her own place this was the first item she requested for Christmas! Easy to use, easy to clean, accommodates large pans, cooks perfectly... couldn't ask for a better little oven, especially considering we only have one built-in oven. Now we can get all our cooking done without having to ask the neighbor to borrow hers! :)
customer_reviews.author: K. Lyle

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to a kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Although I’ve only had this for a week, I’m happy with it thus far. The footprint is good. It’s a reasonable size and take up less room than my Hamilton Beach that proceeded it. Still, it accommodates my usual oven baking pans. It has two shelves and it works well baking two things simultaneously. It keeps heat in very well. The front is very warm but the sides and the top, not si much. It heats exactly. I used an oven thermometer to check. I have just baked chicken and fish so far and everything worked well. The controls are intuitive and the equipment seems very solid. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Berman

customer_reviews.title: Love my Cuisinart Toaster Convection Oven!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for everything! I bake, great for pizzas and toast! The dial is easy to use, interior light is so helpful as are the preheat and done bells. Takes a lot of counter room but I use this so much its worth it! The convection makes for perfect and faster baking and is quiet. Just don't wash the pizza stone like I did ha! I didn't know it absorbed the soap. Took a lot of online remedies to get the soap smell and taste out! Cuisinart products are the best I have several of their small appliances, and yes you pay more for quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: I use the daily
customer_reviews.text: Love this oven, with only two of us in the household this is the perfect size oven for preparing our meals, works great, true to temp, I love the timer that actually turns the oven off when it is complete, and the beeper noise is not to loud to be obnoxious.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Berry

customer_reviews.title: Great general conection/toaster
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a very old convection toaster Pros: larger and can fit a frozen pizza whole multiple racks for different heating levels Cons: time consuming to select everything, could use some pre-set buttons
customer_reviews.author: mandys08

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: After getting over sticker shock on toaster/convection oven prices, I started narrowing the field selected this Cuisinart. After 5 months, I've been very pleased. First, though, it's not small. It's 20" wide, 11" high and almost 15" deep (including the handle). It takes up some counter space. That said, it's been a joy to use. It's plenty quiet, cooks fast, cooks evenly and doesn't get too hot on the exterior. The controls are easy to use, although the dial is a tad sensitive and the inked on labels are already starting to wear off ... neither are big deal for me as I now use this oven almost exclusively.
customer_reviews.author: NA

customer_reviews.title: Cooked Evenly - Great Cuisinart Chef's Convection Toaster
customer_reviews.text: Wow Wonderful Chef's Convection Toaster - My husband I cooked steaks with sauce it cooked evenly and without burning the meat. I would buy again from this vendor. The SPEED Convection is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Multi Functional
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this oven to toast, bake, broil, roast. The convection option speeds up cooking. I also use it to reheat food quickly and with better results than the microwave. It’s pretty easy to clean except for the top of the inside. It saves on oven use but it does take up a lot of counter space.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Really Like It So Far!
customer_reviews.text: Really like this unit so far, only been one month. Makes perfect toast but takes a bit longer, worth it. Great for heating up slices of cold pizza! The slide out wire shelf is a bit of a pain to get to go back in when hot. It slides out when you open the door but does not slide back in when closing. You must use a utensil to close it if you do not want to get burned. The only reason for not giving it 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: N2WATA

customer_reviews.title: Door doesn't close completely
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a couple of months and use it daily. So far so good, except for one rather crucial design flaw: the door wont fully close. Which means that not only is there significant heat loss (enough to burn yourself), but the interior light, which is triggered by the door, comes on whenever there is even a minor vibration, such as someone walking across the kitchen floor, and will probably burn out soon and doesn't appear to be replacable (at least not without taking the oven apart). It does get very hot and cooks food quickly and, assuming it lasts, would be a good little oven for the price (presently @ $200) if only the door would shut.
customer_reviews.author: m. itchovich

customer_reviews.title: Great oven. Wish I bought it sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. We’ve used it almost every day since we received it. We rely on our oven much less and are saving money in the process!
customer_reviews.author: T. Behringer

customer_reviews.title: Nice range of options
customer_reviews.text: Is any oven actually easy to clean? It isn't horrible though. Cleans fairly easily. I love the range of options. From toasting, bagels, and waffles to the instant cooking options. When I just want something quick, the instant heating/cooking with speed convection has made the difference between if I bother to fix dinner or just pass all together. It is a little bulky in size with the convection. But well worth it! I have not tried the dual cook option yet.
customer_reviews.author: Wlfhund Dog Mama

customer_reviews.title: Works fine both as my only oven and as a toaster
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a stove with an oven. I wanted something that could be used as a replacement for an oven in a stove and also work well for toasting. This oven works fine. It is easier to use the electronic controls than I expected and it also works great for just toasting a couple of pieces of bread. It also looks good and is easier to clean than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Weatherbird

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working fine so far
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be working fine so far. No major complaints from my wife. We are still learning how to set best for toast -- so far we are having more trouble finding the perfect (not too crisp, not to soft, evenly toasted on both sides) that we had with the Cuisinart that this replaced. The bearings (I assume from the noise) went bad on the convection fan of the old Cuisinart (we had it for a number of years). Based on our experience today and price at the time, we would order this one again. We are a retired couple and like many people, rarely use our regular double oven.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm Clark

customer_reviews.title: High Class
customer_reviews.text: I really never expected to get compliments about my toaster oven, but on this one I have. So apparently if you want something that looks really good on your countertop, this is the one to buy. When I decided to buy this, I thought the idea of a light inside a toaster oven was kind of silly, but I actually really like it and it's a nice touch. Not gonna lie - I've never used anything other than the toast function - but it does a good job of toasting!
customer_reviews.author: ZiggyTimu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The very best pandemic purchase! The convection oven is new to me. Of course I had to make a cake and it turned out perfect! Now able to roast veggies without making a hot mess. My most favorite features (2)....the timer....not making oven sacrifices any more and does not heat up the kitchen at all! ❤️ ❤️ ❤️
customer_reviews.author: Beb

customer_reviews.title: timer fails in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: for an expensive toaster unit such as this, it is truly unacceptable that a basic element such as timer should fail.
customer_reviews.author: product user

customer_reviews.title: Cook everything!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my tiny apartment. It sits on top of a half-fridge. It is easy to operate and extremely versatile. I have cooked a whole chicken, brownies, and often use it for toasting bialys. I think it surpasses a microwave in usefulness, except for quick re-heat, which of course the microwave is good for. But this is a dandy, heats up quickly and very easy to clean. Everything seems to cook a little faster. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Convection Toaster Oven
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Convection Toaster Oven. We make everything in it. From toast to roast. Highly recommend this product. I even purchased 1 for the in-laws and they absolutely love it. Frozen baking products like croissants come out great just watch your time because the convection is faster than normal baking.
customer_reviews.author: Coastie

customer_reviews.title: Loving it! Use it everyday.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why people are saying the button labels rub off. Maybe it's the cleaner they are using? I've had no troubles and I love using this little oven instead of my large oven when just making things for my husband and I. When cooking for the whole family (3 kids), I switch to the standard oven, but for daily use, this beats my old toaster oven by far! They shouldn't even label this a toaster oven, just small convection oven is a great description.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Functional beauty
customer_reviews.text: I know it’s just a toaster oven, but it’s really pretty, so I don’t mind the amount of space it takes up sitting on my counter. It has many different pre-set features, which are helpful; you can just quickly set the proper function and time and go do something else until it is finished. It’s easy to keep clean and the cooking items included are a much higher quality than those provided with any other toaster oven I have owned, even at a similar price point. The cookbook that was included is also a helpful addition.
customer_reviews.author: kvg3819

customer_reviews.title: Best kitchen addition ever
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the most versatile products I’ve ever used... love it so much that I bought 2, for both home and office. When company is over, it gives me another opportunity to cook and quickly! Heats up easier than my oven, allows me to multitask and I’m just a huge fan. If you have a toaster oven, give it away and get this- you will be thrilled you did.
customer_reviews.author: she heff

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after about a year
customer_reviews.text: Our second one worked great for about a year, started getting shocked when touching it, threw it out to be on the safe side. Now have a cheap 4 slice toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The unit arrived in good condition. It works well. The only significant issue I have is with the preheating feature. The unit seems to work on a programmed time to preheat, not when the oven hits a designated temperature in the oven. As such, it typically reaches the preheat temp, but will keep that temp for several minutes until the bell goes off indicating it is time to place the items to be cooked in the oven. this wastes a considerable amount of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: camper

customer_reviews.title: Great compact convection oven
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for almost 2 months and use it frequently. I’m impressed with it! Just make sure you’ve preheated it before placing in your food items or it may burn. The convection aspect works pretty well. The outside does get hot so make sure you have sufficient clearance.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have had my for a few weeks but I have completely eliminated my need to use the oven on my stove .. therefore I don’t have to heat up the whole house to cook. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Connie P.

customer_reviews.title: Great oven, just a little lighter quality build
customer_reviews.text: Whether you're toasting a couple slices of bread or some chicken nuggets, this oven does the job well. The pre-heating timer is great and so is the many other pre-set settings. The food also cooks much faster and evenly. The only thing I didn't like as much was the overall build, the handle and over quality felt a little lighter for a toaster oven in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart Oven is no lightweight in terms of quality and style.
customer_reviews.text: This product was exactly what I was looking for in terms of price, quality, size, and application. It fits under the kitchen cabinets with side and bottom venting which was important to me. I didn't find it overly difficult to program as some have mentioned in previous reviews. Baking in the convection mode was a learning curve for me however.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Brown

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: We've had this oven for around a month. It has been used daily. It's just my wife and I and I got tired of firing up the big oven to bake a half a dozen cookies or roast a couple of chicken breast. I figured this would cut down on the larger oven's use and expense. This toaster oven has done exactly what I wanted. No complaints or any dissatisfaction. Hopefully it is a quality product and will continue to give service for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: James Mundy

customer_reviews.title: A good appliance
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a toaster oven. I haven’t used our regular oven but once since getting this. Easy to use. The process of setting time, temperature and function is intuitive. We have it mounted at eye level and it is much better than having to squat down to check what is in the oven
customer_reviews.author: terry

customer_reviews.title: Hate lighting the pilot light on the RV
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the RV propane oven with this versitile convection toaster oven. It is a bit slower than a toaster for just toast, although you can broil bread with butter on it (+). Used it a few times on our last outing and it works well. Now while on our 4 month summer outings I can bake bread and my own pizzas. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick George

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older convection toaster oven with this. OMG. What a difference. This has been unbelievable compared to the old one. First thing I did was check the temps. My old one was wayyyy off (wish I'd known that years ago). This was only a few degrees off which is no big deal. Everything about it is awesome. Does get really hot on the outside but so did the other one. Comes with quality items also. The dials are super light and feathery to use. I love it and if it holds up like I expect I'd buy it again in heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: David K

customer_reviews.title: Favorite kitchen appliance
customer_reviews.text: Favorite kitchen appliance! We have one of these bad boys at work and I'm obsessed with how quick and efficient it cooks all sorts of foods, and there are loads of different settings that are super easy to toggle between. When my toaster died at home, I had the perfect excuse to splurge and order one of these for personal use! It shipped quickly, was packaged carefully, and arrived safe and soundly.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Very useful appliance
customer_reviews.text: This is a duplicate of one I have in my kitchen, purchased for a vacation condo. Though my husband refuses to learn how to do anything but "toast" with it (no matter what he's cooking), it is actually pretty user friendly and has mostly replaced my built-in ovens when cooking for the two of us. Does everything well from "warm" to "broil" and, of course, "toast."
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Toaster Oven
customer_reviews.text: I love this toaster oven! I’ve used it every day since it’s been purchased. I’ve toasted bread and waffles, baked cheesecake, roasted an entire chicken, and more. Wish we had bought this sooner! My only issue is that you cannot really clean oil splatters from off the heating elements, but everything else wipes clean easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Small Oven
customer_reviews.text: Terrific small oven. But it is really too large to be considered a "toaster oven" as one would assume. It can easily fit a chicken, small casserole. But it is pretty big to just toast one piece of bread. So if one is looking for a small oven, this is it. I love it also b/c I don't have to heat up a large oven to cook a casserole or roast a chicken, this heats up quickly and cooks like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: ELIZABETH

product_meta.title: Cuisinart TOB-260N1 Chef's Convection Toaster Oven, Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: Color:Stainless SteelCuisinart chef's convection oven boasts 15 cooking functions and offers special settings for speed convection, sandwiches and bagels. Heating power of 1800 watts provides quick heat up time, precise temperature and perfect results every time. The easy-clean nonstick interior is so roomy it can hold a 13-inch pizza, 9 slices of bread, a 9" x 13" baking pan or an entire 9-pound chicken. Easiest way to make a real home-cooked meal - every day!
feature_bullets: Spacious 0.95 cubic-foot capacity oven Fits 13" pizza and 9" x 13" baking pan
15 cooking functions, including innovative dual cook, and speed convection.
Digital controls with large blue backlit display and LED buttons. BPA free; Convenient auto-slideout rack
Always even toast shade control offers consistent results slice after slice. Interior light
Unit Actual Dimensions: 20.87" L x 16.93" W x 11.42" H

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,337 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
